etymology.description: A horizontal stroke, indicating the number 'one'
etymology.interpretation: The simplest representation of 'one' as a horizontal line makes intuitive sense because it visually signifies a singular unit, an elemental stroke itself.

examples.chinese: 我只有一只猫(我只有一隻貓)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhǐ yǒu yī zhī māo.

examples.chinese: 给我一杯水(給我一杯水)。
examples.english: Give me a glass of water.

examples.chinese: 他是一个好人(他是一個好人)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì yī gè hǎo rén.
